20110128140012.000|20110128140014.000|TR0|
20110128140014.000|20110128140017.000|TR0|It is rippling across the world right now. 
20110128140017.000|20110128140019.000|TR0| A fourth day of riots erupting across 
20110128140019.000|20110128140022.000|TR0|Egypt, a key U.S. ally in the region.  And 
20110128140022.000|20110128140024.000|TR0|the anti- government protests have now 
20110128140024.000|20110128140027.000|TR0|spread to a fifth country, Jordan.  But 
20110128140027.000|20110128140029.000|TR0|the most violent clashes are in major 
20110128140029.000|20110128140032.000|TR0|cities across Egypt.
20110128140032.000|20110128140035.000|TR0|

20110128140050.000|20110128140052.000|TR0|more bloody.

20110128140411.000|20110128140414.000|TR0|police.  They threatened us with their

20110128140417.000|20110128140419.000|TR0|then they stole our camera and broke it.
20110128140419.000|20110128140422.000|TR0|
20110128140422.000|20110128140424.000|TR0|And that's not -- it's not -- CNN isn't 
20110128140424.000|20110128140427.000|TR0|the story here, obviously.  There's --

20110128141112.000|20110128141115.000|TR0|place to come visit and tour the Nile and 
20110128141115.000|20110128141117.000|TR0|see the pyramids.
20110128141117.000|20110128141120.000|TR0|
20110128141120.000|20110128141123.000|TR0|And this is the complete opposite, I 
20110128141123.000|20110128141125.000|TR0|think, of what a lot of Americans 
20110128141125.000|20110128141128.000|TR0|visualize when they think of Egypt.
20110128141128.000|20110128141130.000|TR0|
20110128141130.000|20110128141133.000|TR0|WEDEMAN:  Certainly.  And Egypt is truly a 
20110128141133.000|20110128141135.000|TR0|beautiful country with friendly people and 
20110128141135.000|20110128141138.000|TR0|you couldn't be more welcome.  But it 
20110128141138.000|20110128141140.000|TR0|always hides -- tourists oftentimes don't 
20110128141140.000|20110128141143.000|TR0|see the reality, which is that this is a 
20110128141143.000|20110128141146.000|TR0|country where a very tiny minority of rich 
20110128141146.000|20110128141148.000|TR0|and well-connected people to the regime 
20110128141148.000|20110128141151.000|TR0|live an incredibly sumptuous lifestyle, 
20110128141151.000|20110128141153.000|TR0|while the vast majority of Egyptians has 
20110128141153.000|20110128141156.000|TR0|to struggle with just getting by.
20110128141156.000|20110128141158.000|TR0|
20110128141158.000|20110128141201.000|TR0|In fact, this morning, I came in with a 
20110128141201.000|20110128141203.000|TR0|taxi driver who told me he is upset about 
20110128141203.000|20110128141206.000|TR0|these protests because he needs to make 
20110128141206.000|20110128141209.000|TR0|about $10 a day to feed his four children. 
20110128141209.000|20110128141211.000|TR0| He said, I can't do it.  And he went and 
20110128141211.000|20110128141214.000|TR0|he asked his boss for an advance.  He 
20110128141214.000|20110128141216.000|TR0|said, no, I'm just not going to give you 
20110128141216.000|20110128141219.000|TR0|the money because I don't have it.
20110128141219.000|20110128141221.000|TR0|
20110128141221.000|20110128141224.000|TR0|And so people here live, you know, 
20110128141224.000|20110128141226.000|TR0|day-by-day.  According to the World Bank, 
20110128141226.000|20110128141229.000|TR0|40 percent of the Egyptian population 
20110128141229.000|20110128141231.000|TR0|lives on less than $2 a day.  The feeling 
20110128141231.000|20110128141234.000|TR0|is that this is a country with great 
20110128141234.000|20110128141237.000|TR0|potential, great potential wealth but it's 
20110128141237.000|20110128141239.000|TR0|been monopolized by a tiny minority at the 
20110128141239.000|20110128141242.000|TR0|top which is backed up by a regime that 
20110128141242.000|20110128141244.000|TR0|has very little qualms when it comes to 
20110128141244.000|20110128141247.000|TR0|crushing open sort of street dissent.
20110128141247.000|20110128141249.000|TR0|
20110128141249.000|20110128141252.000|TR0|The regime has always been quite tolerant 
20110128141252.000|20110128141254.000|TR0|of, you know, parlor talk and complaints 
20110128141254.000|20110128141257.000|TR0|and idle complaints, and even criticism in 
20110128141257.000|20110128141300.000|TR0|the press.  What it's not tolerant of is 
20110128141300.000|20110128141302.000|TR0|when people come out in the street and 
20110128141302.000|20110128141305.000|TR0|voice their grievances the way we've seen 
20110128141305.000|20110128141307.000|TR0|them doing since Tuesday.
20110128141307.000|20110128141310.000|TR0|
20110128141310.000|20110128141312.000|TR0|And I think Egyptians have been 
20110128141312.000|20110128141315.000|TR0|electrified by suddenly discovering that 
20110128141315.000|20110128141317.000|TR0|people have power in Egypt, that they can 
20110128141317.000|20110128141320.000|TR0|raise their voices and they hope to be 
20110128141320.000|20110128141322.000|TR0|heard, but we heard nothing from President 
20110128141322.000|20110128141325.000|TR0|Hosni Mubarak since this broke out.
20110128141325.000|20110128141328.000|TR0|

20110128141333.000|20110128141335.000|TR0|ruling National Democratic Party.  And I

20110128143251.000|20110128143254.000|TR0|economy grow and, this time around, Wall 
20110128143254.000|20110128143256.000|TR0|Street expected a bit better.  But hey, 
20110128143256.000|20110128143259.000|TR0|3.2 percent isn't too bad, either. It's 
20110128143259.000|20110128143301.000|TR0|actually considerably faster than what we 
20110128143301.000|20110128143304.000|TR0|had in the second and third quarters.  It 
20110128143304.000|20110128143306.000|TR0|shows that recovery is continuing and is 
20110128143306.000|20110128143309.000|TR0|actually picking up some speed.
20110128143309.000|20110128143311.000|TR0|
20110128143311.000|20110128143314.000|TR0|Now, consumer spending really drove growth 
20110128143314.000|20110128143316.000|TR0|in the fourth quarter. Spending rose at 
20110128143316.000|20110128143319.000|TR0|the fastest rate in almost five years.  
20110128143319.000|20110128143322.000|TR0|Now, this did include the holiday season, 
20110128143322.000|20110128143324.000|TR0|where we expect consumers to go ahead and 
20110128143324.000|20110128143327.000|TR0|spend their dough, but spending also was 
20110128143327.000|20110128143329.000|TR0|up because confidence is rising and 
20110128143329.000|20110128143332.000|TR0|unemployment is falling.
20110128143332.000|20110128143334.000|TR0|
20110128143334.000|20110128143337.000|TR0|Also helping our economic growth, we did 
20110128143337.000|20110128143339.000|TR0|export more goods than we imported, but we 
20110128143339.000|20110128143342.000|TR0|do still have the weak housing market and 
20110128143342.000|20110128143345.000|TR0|a drop in government spending.  Those are 
20110128143345.000|20110128143347.000|TR0|still issues and a drag on our recovery.  
20110128143347.000|20110128143350.000|TR0|Still we are expecting stocks to open a 
20110128143350.000|20110128143352.000|TR0|bit higher today. Kyra?

20110128144154.000|20110128144157.000|TR0|ZARRELLA:  Well, you know, we didn't have 
20110128144157.000|20110128144200.000|TR0|a satellite truck back then, Kyra, out 
20110128144200.000|20110128144202.000|TR0|here back in 1986.  We had phone reports I 
20110128144202.000|20110128144205.000|TR0|was doing from the space center, but I 
20110128144205.000|20110128144207.000|TR0|remember I was standing down at the 
20110128144207.000|20110128144210.000|TR0|countdown clock when the vehicle lifted 
20110128144210.000|20110128144212.000|TR0|off with all of the other members of the 
20110128144212.000|20110128144215.000|TR0|media.  It was kind of tradition.  We 
20110128144215.000|20110128144217.000|TR0|stood by the lagoon there.
20110128144217.000|20110128144220.000|TR0|
20110128144220.000|20110128144222.000|TR0|And when the explosion took place from our 
20110128144222.000|20110128144225.000|TR0|vantage point, you couldn't see with a 
20110128144225.000|20110128144228.000|TR0|naked eye the fireball.  After a few 
20110128144228.000|20110128144230.000|TR0|seconds, realizing just this huge cloud up 
20110128144230.000|20110128144233.000|TR0|there that something was very wrong. Ran 
20110128144233.000|20110128144235.000|TR0|back up towards my cameraman who was 
20110128144235.000|20110128144238.000|TR0|filming.  I said, "Steve, what happened?"  
20110128144238.000|20110128144240.000|TR0|And he said, "It exploded."
20110128144240.000|20110128144243.000|TR0|
20110128144243.000|20110128144245.000|TR0|And I remember very vividly running up to 
20110128144245.000|20110128144248.000|TR0|the press center, and it was absolute 
20110128144248.000|20110128144251.000|TR0|chaos inside there.  Journalists 
20110128144251.000|20110128144253.000|TR0|screaming, "Get us over to the landing 
20110128144253.000|20110128144256.000|TR0|strip, we need to be at the landing 
20110128144256.000|20110128144258.000|TR0|strip!" Because there was a feeling 
20110128144258.000|20110128144301.000|TR0|perhaps the vehicle had survived and the 
20110128144301.000|20110128144303.000|TR0|astronauts would try what is called an 
20110128144303.000|20110128144306.000|TR0|RTLS, return to landing site, and try to 
20110128144306.000|20110128144308.000|TR0|get the vehicle back.  But that never 
20110128144308.000|20110128144311.000|TR0|happened, obviously, because quickly as we 
20110128144311.000|20110128144313.000|TR0|heard in that sound at the top, NASA came 
20110128144313.000|20110128144316.000|TR0|out and confirmed very quickly that the 
20110128144316.000|20110128144319.000|TR0|vehicle had exploded.
20110128144319.000|20110128144321.000|TR0|
20110128144321.000|20110128144324.000|TR0|It was the beginning of many long months 
20110128144324.000|20110128144326.000|TR0|up here, Kyra, and certainly something

20110128144453.000|20110128144456.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  Las Vegas.  Sin City.  You can 
20110128144456.000|20110128144458.000|TR0|gamble, you can go to a different strip 
20110128144458.000|20110128144501.000|TR0|club every night for weeks, but you better 
20110128144501.000|20110128144503.000|TR0|not jaywalk.  See the wounded 13-year-old 
20110128144503.000|20110128144506.000|TR0|girl right here?  A car going about 45 
20110128144506.000|20110128144508.000|TR0|miles an hour hit her.  She was in a coma 
20110128144508.000|20110128144511.000|TR0|for about a week. While she was lying in 
20110128144511.000|20110128144513.000|TR0|the hospital, a cop gave her a jaywalking 
20110128144513.000|20110128144516.000|TR0|ticket.  Gave it to her distraught mom.
